availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter S. Anderson (Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and trader.)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and trader. Mason County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Patton Anderson. Father of Leonard Anderson, Elizabeth Anderson, Thomas Anderson, Amanda Anderson Dobyns. Lewis Anderson, Mollie Anderson Osborne. Farmer in Mason County in 1850. Employed John Mehatt and James Madden as farm workers in 1850. Farmer and trader in Mason County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
"A Pioneer Gone: Death of Peter S. Anderson at his Home in Dover Yesterday," The Evening Bulletin, Maysville, Kentucky, 1 Sep 1888, p. 3, https://www.newspapers.com/image/71171606/?terms=%22Peter%2BS%2BANderson%22 (accessed 16 May 2017).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 1, p. 26A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Lower District, p. 32.
